title: Garbaruk Displays Prototype Electronic Rear Derailleur and Shifter at Bespoked UK – John Watson
content:
At Bespoked UK, Ukrainian manufacturer Garbaruk unveiled a bit of its normally secretive R&D: an electronic rear derailleur and shifter. John took some stunning photos of this equally as flash kit while attending the framebuilder showcase, so let’s check them out below…

I was walking the halls of the Bespoked UK showcase when I saw show co-owner Petor Georgallou chatting with two gentlemen in the Garbaruk booth, holding something shiny. Peeking over his shoulder, Petor was clicking a device in one hand and holding a blue and red rear derailleur in the other.

The Ukraine-based manufacturer has been working on completing an entire drivetrain kit with a mountain bike and road bike shifter for its all-new CNC’d in house electronic derailleur. The finish is pristine and in the same class Garbaruk is known for, even on this prototype product, which was displayed on a bike we’ll showcase tomorrow.

They are using their own BlueTooth-actuated servos with a proprietary battery interface. The shifter feels solid and actuates easily, while tucking on a 22.2 bar clamp right next to your brake levers. What’s nice about the system is the “click” of the shifter, which makes a pleasant sound and feels like an indexed shift.

Garbaruk is working to bring the new MTB and road shifter along with the rear derailleur to market by the end of the year. The road shifter will be a button that fits into the side of a TRP brake lever. It will be available in all of the brand’s anodizing colors, which is also does in-house. What was perhaps the most impressive was the unit’s weight. It felt much lighter in hand than other market options.

Pricing is to be determined but as with Garbaruk‘s other products, it will be well worth the expense.
